Title: Implementation of Data Collecting Platform over Distributed Sensors for Global Open Data for Agriculture and Nutrition
Source title: 2018 6th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management, CITSM 2018
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program, Information Technology, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Engineering, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yuyanto, Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program, Information Technology, Jakarta, Indonesia; Liawatimena, S., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Engineering, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Agriculture nowadays deals with numerous factors to support the success of the harvest, such as temperature, air pressure, air humidity, sunlight, soil moisture, rainfall. With so much data that can be collected and analyzed, it is expected to create an early warning system if there are parameters that are already in the critical value and are at risk of causing crop failure. As information technology is developing rapidly, it could be utilized as a tool to support the effort in facing this issue. this study will focus on providing a reliable open data platform which is accessible to relevant stakeholders Google Cloud Platform is selected to serve this purpose to mitigate the risk of maintaining a reliable high availability platform. Google Cloud IoT Core is configured to accept MQTT protocol message sent by sensors. Other google cloud functionality will be configured to store the message into google NoSQL database. Google cloud function will be used to provide data if any request of data to server is being made through REST webservice call. As a result, all the configured Google functionalities are able to synchronize to store and retrieve data. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Big Data Application; Data Integration; Internet of Things; Mobile Applications; Web Services
Index Keywords: Agriculture; Data integration; Internet of things; Soil moisture; Web services; Big data applications; Cloud platforms; Data collecting; Distributed sensor; Early Warning System; High availability; Mobile applications; Protocol message; Open Data
